content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks good to me! I like it and the description was right to the point.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a creative idea, I see no flaws with it. Very cool concept.
That is such a cool question, love it

Nice, the examples are pretty self explanatory, it just seems weird to me that in this context the limit is the number of occurences to exceed, instead of the number of occurences to be equal to or more than. And it's confusing since in the Input you say 'An integer limit for the MINIMUM length of consecutive run of the same letter where compression should be performed.'
Please follow up my latest comments I made 7 days ago. Thank you.

Maybe I'm quibbling a bit there, but what's the point of the constraint string length <= 10^5 when you wrote 1024 in the stub ? (In fact you can't  even give more than 10000 characters in the input), looks good otherwise

What's the point of this part:

"If the compressed string is not shorter than the original string, return the original string but if they are equal in length, then return the compressed string."

This never happens? It could only be possible with length 1 RLE (with sth like: a < a1) but then again your limit is >= 1 so it's not possible.

You can see here that I didn't even code that part, yet I passed everything (ruby):

s = gets.chomp
l = gets.to_i
puts s.gsub(/((.)\2*)/).map{ |m|
  sz = m.size
  sz <= l ? m : m[0] + sz.to_s
}.join
MODIFIED V2.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks good to me, especially on reverse mode. There had been similar clashes of run-length compression, but this one adds a unique twist by adding in a "limit" variable

Goal section
* Please note that the syntax of "compress_string(string: str, limit: int) -> str" may not be applicable to all programming languages.

* Anyway, please delete everything from "Implement the function" up to the end as it repeats most of what has been stated at the beginning.

Input section
* Please follow the example in the link below to present this section:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines

The format is like:
<<Line X:>> A string/integer/variable_type [[variable_name]] for _variable_description_.

* The constraints on the inputs should be moved to the constraints section. Also, please change "len" to "length" - use English words instead of a programming function.

Constraints section
* Please format all the variables.

* Please remove the second constraint. The constraint you originally put in Input section will be placed here instead.

* It is better for the upper limit on the length of the given string to be the same as that you use in the stub generator.

Cases
* Goal section states "If the compressed string is not shorter than the original string, return the original string." But some cases e.g. Validator 2 does not follow the above rule.

* Please revise the cases so that each pair of test and validator are similar (e.g. Test 2 and Test 3 may be a pair, Validator 3 and Validator 4 may be a pair.)

* Suggest to add cases where the same letters appear non-consecutively, e.g. aaaaabbbaaaaaa.

Thanks.
Changed it!

Erm... it's not even solving any equations, it's just assigning the values as given to the variables.

Also, how would it be possible that multiple solutions exist?
Good point. Let me tinker it in a jiffy.
Very helpful! Thank you very much.
Thanks for the approval.
Removing it. Tbh, it's a very irrelevant thing to do.
True enough. Imma just change the stub.
Didn't notice your comment underneath. Thanks, I've changed it based on your suggestions.
Hm, alright. Modified the input and constraint based on your suggestion to remove confusion. Thanks!

Thank you. The problem looks clearer now, but still contains some issues:

Goal section
* Please add that "Compression of a letter should be done only it appears consecutively for more than [[limit]] times."

Input section
* Please delete "The problem takes two parameters:".

Output section
* Please delete "A:".

* Please delete "in parentheses".

Constraints section
* Please amend 10^1 as 10^2.

* Please amend "10^5" as "length of [[string]]".

Thanks again.
Modified based on your suggestions. You have my thanks.

Thank you for making the changes. Below are the comments on the updated version:

Goal section
* Please remove the reference to parentheses as you have changed the output requirement.

Input section
* Please change this to:
<<Line 1:>> The [[string]].
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[limit]] for the minimum length of consecutive run of the same letter where compression should be performed.

Constraints section
* Please remove all line numbers.

* Please change "[[string_length]]" to "length of [[string]]".

* Please change both 10^5 to upper limits more reflective of the actual cases covered, e.g. 100.

* Please remove the last three items (Lines 3 to 4 are just repetition, and Line 5 is not a constraint on the possible cases).

Stub generator
* Please change "strings" to "string" for consistency with other sections.

Thanks.

A similar clash already exists:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/21701750adc31ebffd57cb0b8454abd6db9a
I guess I have to find some interesting concepts. Lemme just change it entirely.
